subject: Swimming
lead_paragraph: Michael Phelps won twice in about an hour at the United States national championships in Indianapolis, coming close to setting a world record in the 100-meter backstroke yesterday. Phelps’s backstroke time of 53.01 seconds was the second-fastest ever, .03 off Aaron Peirsol’s mark, set in March at the world championships. Phelps set a meet record in the 200 freestyle in 1:44.98, then regrouped and still had enough energy to swim what his coach, Bob Bowman, called his best closing 50 in the 100 back.
